name: Acceptance
body:
### Welcome to COMP2911 Acceptance Tests
This is the *official acceptance test page for COMP2911 at the Univesity Of New South Wales. Here you can download the latest release of the acceptance tests for your major work in the course above. If you have any issues downloading, installing or implementing the testing framework please contact us as outlined below. You can *earn strawberry cupcakes if you are especially awesome.
 
### Contributors
Below is a list of the student representatives github accounts that are currently contributing to the acceptance tests for the course. Feel free to check out the other projects they are working on in their spare time on their pages:

* @bwright (Ben Wright)
* @shocklateboy92 (Lasath Fernando)
* @sarahbennett (Sarah Bennett)
* @Dazuraz (Wen Di)
* @lspooner (Ms Spooner) 
* @damonkey2 (Damon)
* @MatthewDMoss (Matthew Moss)

### Strawberry Cupcakes!
![(>-_-)> COOKIE BATTLE! <(-_-<)](http://s3-ec.buzzfed.com/static/imagebuzz/terminal01/2009/2/2/13/cookie-monster-cupcake-1547-1233600439-16.jpg)Some students in the course are just awesome and despite not being acceptance representatives have suggested some really cool changes. Instead of pretending we did all the work I thought it would be better to list them all here, they really deserve some strawberry cupcakes for all their hard work!

* @tetrakai [2 points] - Forking the repository and triaging bugs.

### Support or Contact
Are you having trouble getting the acceptance tests running? No problem, your first point of contact should be to create a comment or a page listing "the magic string" listed on the [acceptance test page](https://www.openlearning.net/courses/COMP461394/12s1/acceptanceReps). If you cannot access that page because your browser is allergic to javascript (elinks!) you can just send a email suggestion to:

bwright (at) cse.unsw.ed.au with the subject line STRAWBERRY CUPCAKES in the header and I will cc it to everyone in the acceptance testing community.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
